did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle: Papers of the President of the University of Virginia, Office Administrative Files 1987-2003(2002-2003)

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Access is prohibited for ten years from the date of creation unless special permission is granted by the President's Office. Under the terms of the Virginia Freedom of Information Act (Sec. 2.1-343 (4), the records of the president or other chief executive officer of any state-supported institution of higher education are exempt from the law's access provisions.
Additional access restrictions may apply to specific student records under the terms of the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (F.E.R.P.A.).

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of the President of the University of Virginia, Office Administrative Files, Accession #RG-2/1/2.051, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These records were transferred from the Office of the President, Madison Hall, University of Virginia, through Jo Anne Birckhead, on August 12, 2005.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: These files constitute the major record series generated by the president of the University of Virginia, John Thomas Casteen, 12,300 items (41 Hollinger boxes, ca. 17 linear shelf feet) chiefly 2002-2003, but with some files going back to 1987.

The records consist chiefly of correspondence, but also include reports, minutes, clippings, memoranda, and related papers concerning all areas of business of the president's office. Major topics include American Council on Education; Association of American Universities; athletics and the NCAA; the Council for Higher Education Accreditation; development, the General Assembly; gifts and grants; the Governor of Virginia's office; the Mariners' Museum; the Medical Center and the Health Services Foundation; ROTC; Sallie Mae; State Council of Higher Education for Virginia; Student Affairs; and the Board of Visitors.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Both the series and file headings used by the president's office have been retained. Restricted material has been placed in its own series. There are three series: Series I: General Files (Boxes 1-32); Series II: Seldom Used Permanent Files (Boxes 32-34); and, Series III: Restricted Files (Boxes 35-41).
